ranked_diseases.explanation: Waardenburg Syndrome Type 1 is characterized by sensorineural hearing impairment and delayed speech and language development, which are present in the patient.
Waardenburg Syndrome Type 2 also includes sensorineural hearing impairment and can present with delayed speech and language development, though it is less common than Type 1.
Branchiootorenal Syndrome 1 can present with sensorineural hearing impairment and delayed speech and language development, though it often includes additional features not noted in this patient.
Pendred Syndrome is associated with sensorineural hearing impairment and may include delayed speech and language development, though it typically also involves thyroid abnormalities.
Usher Syndrome Type 1 includes sensorineural hearing impairment and delayed speech and language development, but it also typically involves retinitis pigmentosa, which is not mentioned here.
